summary: The Roman Empire was a powerful ancient civilization that ruled over much of Europe, Western Asia, and North Africa. It began as the Roman Republic and expanded its territory. After civil wars, Octavian became the first emperor, known as Augustus, in 27 BC. The empire reached its largest size under Trajan. It faced challenges, including barbarian invasions, leading to the fall of the Western Roman Empire in 476 AD. The Eastern Roman Empire, centered in Constantinople, lasted until 1453. Roman culture, law, and language had a huge impact on the world, shaping religion, art, and government.
title: Roman Empire
